subject: Re: [junit] Avoid System.out
msgSnippet: ... Use fail() with a String representation of the data you want to see. If you need to look at the data, the test must be failing, anyway. Google no more
messageBody:
bkkunam wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
> When we run Junit test cases, I want to see the output values on
> the screen if the test fails. Currently we are using
> System.out.println (variable) to see the value of the variable. Is
> there any other way to see the values without using
> System.out.println function. Appreciate your
> help. Please respond.

Use fail() with a String representation of the data you want to see. If
you need to look at the data, the test must be failing, anyway.

Google "no more println debugging"
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
